result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davyon D Willis

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. D. Willis Firearm safety certificate.pdf

Defendant Davyon D Willis appeared by video.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson appeared by video for Davyon D Willis.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed with prejudice.
Received and Filed. Firearm Safety Course - Certificate and Essay

For reasons discussed with the parties the date and time of the next hearing has been changed. Case is now 8/29/2022 at 10:30 for Review Hearing in branch 21. Parties notified via email.
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Davyon D Willis in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Davyon D Willis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.    Defendant waives In Person appearance; Matter live streamed on Dacast.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights + Addendum
Received and Filed, Notice of Retainer
